Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 40th overall pick, by Coney Island in 1979...
Injured on 5/15/1979 with a Stiff Shoulder, out for 4 days...
Traded from Coney Island to Pittsburgh on 1/31/1980 (Going to PIT: 2B A. Urias. Going to CI: LF G. Cranor)...

Had first career hit (double) on 4/29/1982, off George Popovich (NJ)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/19/1982, off Bill Cook (BC)...
Traded from Pittsburgh to Toledo on 2/19/1985 (Going to PIT: LF H. Vega. Going to TOL: SS A. Urias)...
